Package com.zoho.arattai.core

Class WhatsAppExport

java.lang.Object
com.zoho.arattai.core.WhatsAppExport
public class WhatsAppExport extends Object
Immutable container for a fully-parsed WhatsApp chat export.

A WhatsAppExport instance is created by WhatsAppChatParser.parse(String) after it has read the export ZIP, discovered the chat transcript, and converted every line into a typed Message subclass. Callers obtain the data through the typed accessor methods below rather than by inspecting the raw message list.

Typical usage


 WhatsAppExport export = WhatsAppChatParser.parse("/path/to/export.zip");
 System.out.println("Chat: " + export.getChatName());
 export.printCategorySummary();

 for (AudioMessage audio : export.getAudioMessages()) {
     System.out.println(audio.getAudioName() + " â€“ " + audio.getAudioDuration());
 }
Version:
1.0
Author:
Zoho Arattai

  • Method Details

    • setAllMessages

      public void setAllMessages(List<Message> messages)
      Replaces the entire message list with the supplied list. Called once by the parser after it has processed the full transcript.
      Parameters:
      messages - the ordered list of parsed messages; must not be null

    • addMessage

      public void addMessage(Message message)
      Appends a single message to the end of the list. Use this method when building the export incrementally.
      Parameters:
      message - the message to append; must not be null

    • getAllMessages

      public List<Message> getAllMessages()
      Returns the complete, ordered list of all messages in this export.
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable view of the message list; never null

    • getChatName

      public String getChatName()
      Returns the display name of the chat.
      Returns:
      the chat name; never null

    • getMessageCount

      public int getMessageCount()
      Returns the total number of parsed messages.
      Returns:
      message count, zero or more

    • getTextMessages

      public List<TextMessage> getTextMessages()
      Returns all plain-text messages in this export, preserving their original order.
      Returns:
      a new list containing only TextMessage instances; never null, may be empty

    • getImageMessages

      public List<ImageMessage> getImageMessages()
      Returns all image messages in this export, preserving their original order.
      Returns:
      a new list containing only ImageMessage instances; never null, may be empty

    • getVideoMessages

      public List<VideoMessage> getVideoMessages()
      Returns all video messages in this export, preserving their original order.
      Returns:
      a new list containing only VideoMessage instances; never null, may be empty

    • getAudioMessages

      public List<AudioMessage> getAudioMessages()
      Returns all audio messages in this export, preserving their original order.
      Returns:
      a new list containing only AudioMessage instances; never null, may be empty

    • getDocumentMessages

      public List<DocumentMessage> getDocumentMessages()
      Returns all document/file-attachment messages in this export, preserving their original order.
      Returns:
      a new list containing only DocumentMessage instances; never null, may be empty

    • getStickerMessages

      public List<StickerMessage> getStickerMessages()
      Returns all animated-sticker messages in this export, preserving their original order.
      Returns:
      a new list containing only StickerMessage instances; never null, may be empty

    • getMessagesByType

      public List<Message> getMessagesByType(Message.MessageType type)
      Returns all messages that match the given Message.MessageType.
      Parameters:
      type - the message category to filter by; must not be null
      Returns:
      a new list of matching Message instances in original order; never null, may be empty

    • printCategorySummary

      public void printCategorySummary()
      Prints a formatted category summary to standard output.

      The output includes the chat name, total message count, and individual counts for each of the six supported message categories (TEXT, IMAGE, VIDEO, AUDIO, DOCUMENT, STICKER).
